messages: dba3799464b52d8c7ce5446e998d2bd0 (14:16): i have a gray background-color on a table. but when printed out, the background is white
dba3799464b52d8c7ce5446e998d2bd0 (14:16): any way to print the gray background color?
d939aa9b112296451e8599d9c088ef61 (14:18): can i change the style of <a title="">
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (14:22): lau i think it's in the browser's preferences not to print out the backgrounds, but i might be wrong
dba3799464b52d8c7ce5446e998d2bd0 (14:23): cheater: i think so too. do you know where it can be changed in MSIE?
f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (14:41): when you have the Print dialog box appear, there's a checkbox there

d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:44): i have a very strange problem, i made a site with divs, and everything works, except for one div (the one with the "main" content), its like its disabled or something
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:44): i cant select text inside it, i cant interact with forms inside it
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:46): anyone know why?
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:46): its on an offline server atm :S
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:47): i just put it online to see if it was just me
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:47): but everyone complained about it, so uploaded old design again
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (14:48): put it up elsewhere
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (14:48): we're not gonna do guesswork about your webpage, hey
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:49): but i just noticed something
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:49): the div is inside a "container" div with google ads below it
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:49): when i delete the google ads
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:49): the div works again
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:49): i put em back and div is "disabled" again
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (14:50): tried validating it?
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:50): you mean validate the html?
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:51): either your being sarcastic or i dont get it :|
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:52): k, ive narrowed the problem down to the definition of the div in the css sheet
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:52): cause when i use another div class, it works
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:52): i added float:left
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:53): i compared the two div statements and that was the only big difference
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (14:53): you make webpages with trial and error?
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:53): i dont often use div/css to create my web pages
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (14:53): what do you use then?
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:53): im afraid to say it out loud :<
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:54): in the past, ive had a lot of trouble with divs
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:54): and this time again
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:54): div.googleads { position:relative; float:left; border:none; padding:6px; width:700px; text-align:center }
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (14:54): without the float:left, it disables the content of the div above
357a31aab58f0d09ff81cd054ab21f04 (14:59): hi every body
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (15:00): cheater: any idea as to why this is?

357a31aab58f0d09ff81cd054ab21f04 (15:01): I have a problem with the layout of a page. I wanted to use floating divs instead of tables to layout the page. So I want to simulate 3 columns in a row. But when it comes to splitting the space, problems arise. I want the sides to have 20% of the screen real estate each, and the center <div> to take up the remaining space (60%), but when I give each the desired value and also define a padding they wrapp onto the next line ...
357a31aab58f0d09ff81cd054ab21f04 (15:02): what am  I doing wrong :(
bfff3e56373c4c213f698ebfd155cf33 (15:06): Hello
bfff3e56373c4c213f698ebfd155cf33 (15:06): How to vertical align a text and a picture please ?
01dfc3bbee6738f38a06f534972e5445 (15:08): how is css theme loader coded up so a user can select optionals?
01dfc3bbee6738f38a06f534972e5445 (15:08): for example http://www.csszengarden.com
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (15:11): read up on MVC, it lets you totally disconnect your code from your styling/theme
01dfc3bbee6738f38a06f534972e5445 (15:12): MVC? thanks
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (15:13): it's a coding technique
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (15:13): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Model_view_controller here
d086a635c2f2d3689d351443f620dc3b (15:14): but does it really apply to CSS?
01dfc3bbee6738f38a06f534972e5445 (15:14): damn.. see I got a design that I've been using for awhile and now Im sick of it.. :( but I don't want to totally removed it from the server
01dfc3bbee6738f38a06f534972e5445 (15:14): didn't know if it did or didn't
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (15:14): optimus how do you mean "apply to css"?
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (15:15): themes aren't only css
d086a635c2f2d3689d351443f620dc3b (15:16): Well, I guess. I just took it in the context of 'how is css theme loader coded up so a user can select optionals'
d086a635c2f2d3689d351443f620dc3b (15:16): the csszengarden technique would just be loading a different CSS file depending on what was selected by the user
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (15:16): optimus it's kinda used so that you can make new themes without looking at the backpane code of your page at all
01dfc3bbee6738f38a06f534972e5445 (15:17): right.. but how is that done exactly? and you're saying MVC ?
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (15:17): nah, they have html too
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (15:17): when you submit, you submit an (X)HTML page with css and graphics
01dfc3bbee6738f38a06f534972e5445 (15:17): so Im guessing scripting..
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (15:18): CaptainMorgan just read the page i linked you to :p
2bf01b2344d59f1948f61f9b0ab4bfc0 (15:18): Peace, chaps.

01dfc3bbee6738f38a06f534972e5445 (15:22): the csszengarden technique would just be loading a different CSS file depending on what was selected by the user >> makes it sound simple and yet I need to comprehend the paradigm, which isn't possible at this point.. need sleep. cheers
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (15:23): csszengarden isn't only css files
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (15:23): it's html files as well
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (15:25): perhaps if you read what i said 2 times already..

850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (15:28): I revisited my button code. If someone would like to read about it =) http://www.gamedev.net/community/forums/mod/journal/journal.asp?jn=266903&cmonth=7&cyear=2006&cday=29
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (15:29): yeah, how to create buttons where you change the image from CSS
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (15:29): works cleanly with hover, click and any other events
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (15:29): can you show a running example?

850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (15:53): done! example in place! http://www.gamedev.net/community/forums/mod/journal/journal.asp?jn=266903&cmonth=7&cyear=2006&cday=29
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (15:53): Had to link it outside the article... gonna see if I can get it inside, but there are some HTML restrictions so...

6740c1bff265e69955ecb74d8911bbc4 (16:02): hmm ok thx
a124ab4d7f7be1f02a40083f724d5a55 (16:02): bartden: try to use standard fonts
a124ab4d7f7be1f02a40083f724d5a55 (16:02): they are the best to read
6740c1bff265e69955ecb74d8911bbc4 (16:03): they are, but they want it in a special font
d20912f8a73660445bdd8bd5e9219439 (16:03): how do you set css specifically for firefox or IE?
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (16:04): sqdfpoiupouilmkj: for IE it's easy. use the midpoint filter (i.e. conditional comments to bring in a specialized CSS file)
